questions.question: What is the main goal of effective practice?
options: Spending as much time as possible on one topic
Practicing with as little effort as possible
Improving skills through focused and structured effort
Only repeating what you already know
questions.explanation: Effective practice focuses on deliberate improvement, not just repetition.

questions.question: Why are focused sessions more effective than long, unfocused ones?
options: They take less time overall
They allow for more multitasking
They help maintain concentration and achieve specific goals
They let you skip breaks
questions.explanation: Short, focused sessions prevent fatigue and ensure you're working with clear intent.

questions.question: How does feedback improve practice?
options: It makes the process longer
It points out mistakes and guides improvement
It slows down progress
It is only useful at the end of learning
questions.explanation: Feedback identifies areas to improve, helping you grow faster and avoid repeating errors.

questions.question: Why is regular practice better than infrequent long sessions?
options: It helps avoid feedback
It builds consistency and reinforces learning
It’s easier to remember your schedule
It allows you to study without reviewing
questions.explanation: Frequent practice creates stronger memory connections and long-term skill retention.

questions.question: How does effective practice lead to faster improvement?
options: By cramming more content
By repeating everything equally
By targeting weaknesses and refining technique
By using shortcuts
questions.explanation: Targeting areas of struggle with focus and feedback helps you get better quickly and efficiently.
